title: New year offers hope for fair maps -- Ken Berg
text:
My wish for 2024 is we implement somehow laws and policies that strengthen the principles of democracy in our state. In doing this, we can bring back some of the grandeur, ethics and legacy that fighting Bob La Follette brought to Wisconsin.
The state Supreme Court taking action to require that legislative and congressional maps be redrawn for the 2024 elections will be huge step forward in accomplishing a healthier state of democracy here. New nonpartisan maps aimed at erasing the damaging effects of gerrymandering should instill competitive races where winners will be less predictable. Incumbents will increasingly have to serve all of their constituents, instead of relying on their base of voters that keep them repetitively in office now.
The carryover of this monumental change in legislative and congressional districts should be renewed respect for all salient points of view. The presidential race in November should be held in the context of more competitive races statewide, thereby ensuring fair and impartial outcomes at all levels of government.

Ken Berg, Watertown
